TITLE: The last resort of bankruptcy is rising among Main Street businesses across America
SUMMARY: Bankruptcy filings among small businesses are rising, and more owners will face a critical juncture between epic failure and successful rebound positioning.

TITLE: How Innovation Refunds cashed in on the Employee Retention Credit
SUMMARY: Innovation Refunds is among the companies that cashed in on helping small businesses apply for the Employee Retention Credit.

SUMMARY: SBA-supported lending to women-owned small businesses is up nearly 70% since 2020, reaching over $5 billion in annual loan volume.

SUMMARY: Small businesses are awarded billions of dollars each year in federal contracts, but social and economic mobility factors are now a target of legal challenges.

SUMMARY: The IRS has announced a special withdrawal process for small businesses that wrongly claimed the employee retention tax credit. Here's what to know.

SUMMARY: McDonald's recent decision to raise fees for fast food franchise owners should be a wake-up call to franchisees that costs are increasing.

SUMMARY: As Amazon and other big companies reduce their carbon footprint, they're putting pressure on suppliers to do the same, or risk losing business.

SUMMARY: Purchased an Amazon Prime deal? Maybe an AI wrote the product copy that convinced you to spend. It will be doing more of the pitching.

SUMMARY: NYC's zone-based congestion toll will charge drivers to enter lower Manhattan, which could improve local air quality and fund mass transit improvements.

SUMMARY: The Supreme Court will soon hear a case that could have sweeping effects on the U.S. tax code, including corporate revenue and future wealth tax proposals.

SUMMARY: Companies including UPS and Amazon continue to be challenged by package theft. UPS thinks AI may be the best cop for this crime beat.

SUMMARY: The IRS will immediately stop processing new claims for the employee retention credit to protect filers from a "surge of questionable claims."

SUMMARY: Hawaii wildfires and Hurricane Idalia underscore the costly effects of natural disasters on small business. Knowing the emergency funding options is critical.

SUMMARY: Some lawmakers want to increase the tax-reporting thresholds for Form 1099-K, which covers payments from companies such as Venmo or PayPal. Here's what to know.

SUMMARY: Gas stations will face big decisions related to costs and opportunities as gasoline-powered cars are replaced by EVs.

SUMMARY: Small business owners say social media giants including Meta aren't doing enough to prevent them from becoming hacking victims.

SUMMARY: National labor data shows that only one in five disabled Americans can find work, but Amy and Ben Wright, Bitty & Beau's Coffee founders, are changing that.

SUMMARY: Olympic icon Dominique Dawes wants more than sports records for the kids attending her gymnastics academies. She wants to build champion human beings.

SUMMARY: Consumers have continued to spend amid high inflation, but interest rate hikes and resuming student loan payments could slow that.

SUMMARY: The unemployment rate for teens aged 16 to 19 crept up slightly in June, while the labor participation rate fell year on year.

SUMMARY: LGBTQ-owned businesses reported more rejections than non-LGBTQ businesses that applied for funding, according to a 2022 report.
